Node.definition: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= limb ◄ springing from a tree or bough, ► which can be used to beat someone, ≈ but also symbolizes a new beginning
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = long container, ◄ made of wood or stone; ► used for putting food for one's domestic animals
= state of being devoid of content
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to be a trivial matter|to be of no consequence|to come easy
Node.definition: = state in which an event is regarded as relatively unimportant, not requiring much effort or thought
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
to treat someone or something with insolence and contempt
= state of being responsible for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: bitterness; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= action by which a person experiences an event with another participant or other participants
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: straight way; = behavior that is morally and ethically right
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or animals stop living

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness
= state in which humans experience grief
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure|to fall down
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH|= process by which humans cease to be standing upright and end up flat on the ground
literally: short of nostrils; hence: = inability to restrain oneself from expressing one's displeasure; ≈ regarded as foolishness

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= process by which humans attain an enduring condition or status, ◄ as if it were a permanent gift
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which humans have to make a strong physical effort to complete a specific task, for one's own benefit or in service to another
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
literally: strong; hence: = state in which a state or process takes place with intensity
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= person in whom one has put one's trust; ◄ because of difficult circumstances; ► in order to find protection or safety
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which deities or humans have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state of non existence of a person, place or event
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= state in which humans are in serious trouble, ◄ caused by a loss of status, health, wealth or a combination thereof
literally: long of nostrils, long of breath; hence: = pertaining to not being given to anger
literally: long of nostrils; hence: = ability to restrain oneself from expressing one's displeasure; ≈ regarded as wisdom
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state in which a certain type of behavior is highly appreciated
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

Node.gloss: to push down|to thrust down|to overthrow
Node.definition: literally: to thrust someone down; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to fail in his/her undertaking
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= action by which humans or deities reveal information about themselves to (other) humans

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant an elevated status to humans in the eyes of other people

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= event that brings disgrace upon the person performing it
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
